title.narrative: Ghana (le): Aide ciblée aux pays
Ghana: Targeted country assistance

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

title.narrative: CDC : Programme Management - General
Finalize survey methodology, tools, and TORs for data collection.

target.value: Little data exist that measure the impact of strategies designed to strengthen delivery of vaccines in the second year of life (2YL) and improve coverage of measles second dose and catch-up vaccines. The Ghana 2YL project began in 2015 to address the mult

comment.narrative: 1. Completed. 2. All survey methodology, tools and TORs were developed for data collection. Data collection occurred during August 2020.

title.narrative: Preliminary survey report.

target.value: Little data exist that measure the impact of strategies designed to strengthen delivery of vaccines in the second year of life (2YL) and improve coverage of measles second dose and catch-up vaccines. The Ghana 2YL project began in 2015 to address the multiple challenges that countries face when setting up a new immunization visit in the second year of life. Since then, several delivery and demand side strategies have been underway. To measure change in vaccination coverage and equity resulting from Second Year of Life (2YL) strategies implemented between 2016-2019 we propose the following data collection activities be conducted in three targeted regions: 1) Post-implementation vaccination coverage cluster survey. 2) Post-implementation health facility survey to measure changes in health worker knowledge, attitudes, and practices related to 2YL. This would include topics related to policies, communication, and data recording and reporting practices for MR, MenA, newly introduced vaccines (e.g., IPV, RTS,S), and catch-up vaccines. 3) Qualitative assessments to document key stakeholder experiences and perceived changes related to establishing and strenghtening 2YL routine immunization visits. Data from these assessments will be critical to help guide global efforts in strengthening immunization into 2YL and throughout the life course.

comment.narrative: 1. Completed. 2. Survey data were cleaned and analysed. Preliminary reports were developed by on synthesis of data analysis. Reports were shared with Ghana Health Services.

title.narrative: CDC
Preliminary qualitative data analyzed.

target.value: Technical support to strengthen 2YL platform in Ghana through a pogram assessment; workshops to transfer data analysis/writing skills to national staff; and sub-national workshops to present 2YL intervention assessment findings

comment.narrative: 1. Completed. 2. Qualitative data were collection in August 2020. Data analysis occurred during September 2020 - January 2021. These included thematic analyses, identifying key information from informants. Information was included in preliminary reports to Ghana Health Services in April 2021.

target.value: Technical support to strengthen 2YL platform in Ghana through a pogram assessment; workshops to transfer data analysis/writing skills to national staff; and sub-national workshops to present 2YL intervention assessment findings

comment.narrative: 1. Completed. 2. Dissemination meeting occurred in July 2021, with sharing of all final reports and presentations in May 2021.

title.narrative: WHO : Service Delivery
Service delivery approach suitable to reach missed communities identified and endorsed

target.value: Support four regions (two with low DTP-3 coverage and the other two with high DTP-3 coverage) to identify strategies and activities to reach missed communities and zero-dose children in their microplans

comment.narrative: The WHO Country Office, in collaboration with the EPI Programme of the Ghana Health Service, has provided support to five (5) regions to develop plans that identify strategies and activities to reach poorly covered communities (under-served communities) and zero-dose children especially in hard-to-reach areas. Trainings were organized for these regions together with selected districts to build their capacity in the use of data to identify poorly covered areas and left out children. Due to the unrealistic population/denominator issues, qualitative information was also used to identify other poor performing areas but supposedly have high administrative coverage.

title.narrative: Service delivery related barriers of missed communities to access immunisation services identified and prioritized

target.value: Hold a 2-day advocacy workshops in four regions (two with low DTP-3 coverage and the other two with high DTP-3 coverage) to discuss the need to reach zero-dose children, advocate for the inclusion of 'searching for zero-dose children' and missed communities in microplans

comment.narrative: The WHO Country Office has held advocacy meetings with five regional health directorates including two new regions on the need to identify under-served communities and reach zero-dose children. These discussions were held in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic which affected the operations at outreach sites and overall routine service delivery. The WHO has provided catalytic support to regions and districts to develop microplans and implement activities outlined in these plans to reach out to under-served communities and cover all children. The Reaching Every District (RED) Approach was used as the guideline for the planning of services. Service delivery is currently ongoing (update will be provided in the next reporting window)

target.value: Hold a 2-day advocacy workshops in four regions (two with low DTP-3 coverage and the other two with high DTP-3 coverage) to discuss the need to reach zero-dose children, advocate for the inclusion of 'searching for zero-dose children' and missed communities in microplans

comment.narrative: Yet to agree on a suitable date for this activity

comment.narrative: The cMYP 2020-2024 has been completed. The meeting of the ICC to approve the document is still pending.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Management - General
Upgraded temperature monitiring system installed in all immunization Walk-in Cold Rooms

target.value: Support upgrade of temparature monitoring systems for all immunization Walk-in Cold Rooms

comment.narrative: There were delays in the installation of the Remote Temperature Monitoring Devices (RTMD) in 2020 due to COVID-19 travel restrictions which did not allow the consultant to travel to Ghana. Fortunately, this year, with easing of restrictions, the Ghana Country Office was able to make the necessary arrangements for the consultant to travel to Ghana in May. The RTMD installation and training was conducted from 8th May to 8th June 2021. A total of 17 out of 18 remote temperature monitoring devices (RTMD) have been installed in five national cold rooms/freezer rooms and 10 regional cold rooms/freezer rooms. One RTMD was not installed in the Tamale Walk-in Freezer room in the Northern region. It is currently not functioning and scheduled to be replaced. JICA plans to support the Ghana Health Service to procure a WICR for the six new regions and Northern region. Nine national and regional cold room technicians (user administrators) were trained on the phase III portal. On the job training was also done during the RTMD installation. Following the installation and use of the RTMD by the cold chain technicians at national and regional level, 27 of them were brought together at the National level for a second training on RTMD operation and trouble shooting. The consultant took opportunity to address challenges and difficulties they had experienced following installation. The final report of the activity is yet to be shared by the consultant.

target.value: Support upgrade of temparature monitoring systems for all immunization Walk-in Cold Rooms

comment.narrative: There were delays in the installation of the Remote Temperature Monitoring Devices (RTMD) in 2020 due to COVID-19 travel restrictions which did not allow the consultant to travel to Ghana. Fortunately, this year, with easing of restrictions, the Ghana Country Office was able to make the necessary arrangements for the consultant to travel to Ghana in May. The RTMD installation and training was conducted from 8th May to 8th June 2021. A total of 17 out of 18 remote temperature monitoring devices (RTMD) have been installed in five national cold rooms/freezer rooms and 10 regional cold rooms/freezer rooms. One RTMD was not installed in the Tamale Walk-in Freezer room in the Northern region. It is currently not functioning and scheduled to be replaced. JICA plans to support the Ghana Health Service to procure a WICR for the six new regions and Northern region. Nine national and regional cold room technicians (user administrators) were trained on the phase III portal. On the job training was also done during the RTMD installation. Following the installation and use of the RTMD by the cold chain technicians at national and regional level, 27 of them were brought together at the National level for a second training on RTMD operation and trouble shooting. The consultant took opportunity to address challenges and difficulties they had experienced following installation. The final report of the activity is yet to be shared by the consultant.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Service Delivery
Service delivery related barriers of missed communities to access immunisation services identified and prioritized

target.value: Support low performing districts to implement equity-focused micro-plans for addressing identied barriers to immunization for hard to reach and urban poor populations

comment.narrative: Three regions with low performing districts were supported to implement action plans to reach eligible children. The activity was integrated with vitamin A supplementation and all three regions conducted the mop up campaign in November and December 2020. These activities have been reported on in previous reports. The activity reports have been attached.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply Chain & Procurement
CCEOP implemented according to the Operational Develoipment Plan and performance indicators on trac

target.value: Provide technical support CCEOP implementation to ensure that CCEOP is implemented on schedule

comment.narrative: Through the GAVI CCEOP support, 2,342 out of 2,343 cold chain equipment have been installed in 16 regions in the country. The post installation inspection exercise has been completed and recommendations from the report for installation company has been implemented. CCEOP Project is about 99.9% complete pending the installation of one (1) unit Equipment in Greater Accra Region by 11th June 2021. The Project Management Team (PMT) will conduct a follow up monitoring visit to selected installation sites by end of July 2021 to provide technical assistance to the technical staff on the ground and monitor cold chain equipment use and maintenance. The warranty period for maintenance of the cold chain equipment by Deng is two years, however, they could not confirm to the PMT when the warranty period starts because of the delays in implementation. This will require confirmation from UNICEF SD. Funds have been transferred to EPI to conduct training of 32 cold chain technicians from the 16 regions in Ghana. Vestfrost will facilitate the training and have indicated their availability after July 2021. The PMT has planned to organise the training in August 2021.

target.value: Provide technical support CCEOP implementation to ensure that CCEOP is implemented on schedule

comment.narrative: Through the GAVI CCEOP support, 2,342 out of 2,343 cold chain equipment have been installed in 16 regions in the country. The post installation inspection exercise has been completed and recommendations from the report for installation company has been implemented. CCEOP Project is about 99.9% complete pending the installation of one (1) unit Equipment in Greater Accra Region by 11th June 2021. The Project Management Team (PMT) will conduct a follow up monitoring visit to selected installation sites by end of July 2021 to provide technical assistance to the technical staff on the ground and monitor cold chain equipment use and maintenance. The warranty period for maintenance of the cold chain equipment by Deng is two years, however, they could not confirm to the PMT when the warranty period starts because of the delays in implementation. This will require confirmation from UNICEF SD. Funds have been transferred to EPI to conduct training of 32 cold chain technicians from the 16 regions in Ghana. Vestfrost will facilitate the training and have indicated their availability after July 2021. The PMT has planned to organise the training in August 2021.

title.narrative: PATH : Human Resources for Health

Availability of vaccinators in priority areas (where missed communities and large numbers of zero dose children live) provided to EPI national and sub-national managers and planners for integration into national HIS.

target.value: 2. Support the EPI to build capacity of staff in the newly created regions/ districts in GIS technology to address inequities in immunization service

comment.narrative: TEST

title.narrative: Strategic planning documentation (EVM-IP, CIP, cold chain rehabilitation plan) supported and submitted to MoH, incorporating VfM, sustainability and zero-dose considerations (as applicable)

target.value: 3. Support the EPI to conduct EVMA and incorporate recommendations from the Gavi Vaccine Wastage study

title.narrative: Vaccinators and other PHC health workers are deployed to priority areas; at least 60% of new hires (up to 80 people per region) receive training within first six months of hire

target.value: 4. Support the conduct of Immunization in Practice (IIP) at the subdistrict level staff (4 districts in 2 new regions -OTI and Bono East)

title.narrative: Up to 15 regional level EPI staff in each region trained on effective microplanning and use of data for decision making in OTI and Bono East (2 new regions).

target.value: 5. Support EPI to conduct EPI MLM training for regional and district staff to promote effective microplanning and the use of data for decision making in OTI and Bono East (two new) regions
